H0.text: Satellites have done the most to help predict weather and warn people of approaching storms.

H1.text: Airplanes have done the most to help predict weather and warn people of approaching storms.

H2.text: Barometers are the invention that has done the most to help predict weather and warn people of approaching storms.

H3.text: Maps have done the most to help predict weather and warn people of approaching storms.

A4.text: Weather satellite images helped in monitoring the volcanic ash cloud from Mount St. Helens and activity from other volcanoes such as Mount Etna.

A5.text: Collectively, weather satellites flown by the U.S., China, Europe, India, Russia, and Japan provide nearly continuous observations for a global weather watch.
